title: Exception cause SIGABRT
content:
Overriding the to_s method of an exception and raise it from a sandboxed mruby evaluation result in a abort() call from mruby. This results with the whole ruby process terminating.
Tested on 4cd4dfc855f0cce18b1ee2f318927c13edb20d14
POC
Code 61 Bytes
1# poc.rb
2class A < Exception
3  def to_s
4  end
5end
6raise A.new

Cheers!
steps: Create a custom exception class that inherits from Exception and override the to_s method to return nothing
Raise an instance of this custom exception in a sandboxed mruby environment
vuln_description: Overriding the to_s method of an exception and raising it in a sandboxed mruby environment causes an abort() call, leading to the termination of the entire Ruby process. This occurs due to improper handling of the exception's string conversion in the mruby engine.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward manipulation of exception handling in Ruby, specifically targeting the to_s method override. The interaction between the custom exception and the mruby sandbox environment is somewhat subtle but not highly complex. The attack does not require multiple components or complex state manipulation.
